body:
<!-- Thanks for filing an issue! Before hitting the button, please answer these questions.-->

**Is this a request for help?** (If yes, you should use our troubleshooting guide and community support channels, see http://kubernetes.io/docs/troubleshooting/.):


**What keywords did you search in Kubernetes issues before filing this one?** (If you have found any duplicates, you should instead reply there.):

---

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?** (choose one): BUG REPORT

<!--
If this is a BUG REPORT, please:
  - Fill in as much of the template below as you can.  If you leave out
    information, we can't help you as well.

If this is a FEATURE REQUEST, please:
  - Describe *in detail* the feature/behavior/change you'd like to see.

In both cases, be ready for followup questions, and please respond in a timely
manner.  If we can't reproduce a bug or think a feature already exists, we
might close your issue.  If we're wrong, PLEASE feel free to reopen it and
explain why.
-->

**Kubernetes version** (use `kubectl version`):
build-25c2f56967-5-v1.7.5-3

**Environment**:
- **Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: Laptop (bare metal)
- **OS** (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Fedora 26
- **Kernel** (e.g. `uname -a`): Linux localhost.localdomain 4.11.0-0.rc6.git0.1.fc26.x86_64 #1 SMP Mon Apr 10 19:45:50 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- **Install tools**: make && hack/local-cluster-up.sh -o _output/bin


**What happened**:
built from  fb3353c and ran with local-cluster-up.sh

All `kubectl` commands gave the following error: `serializer for text/plain; charset=utf-8 doesn't existserializer for text/plain; charset=utf-8 doesn't exist`

Running `kubectl ... -v 8` showed the output: https://paste.fedoraproject.org/paste/Npp5QOqHiOXe07lpMkdXQV5M1UNdIGYhyRLivL9gydE=/ 

**What you expected to happen**:
for `kubectl` commands to work, and Content-type to show `application/json`

**How to reproduce it** (as minimally and precisely as possible):
```
#from fb3353c:
make && hack/local-cluster-up.sh -o _output/bin
#in another session
kubectl proxy
```

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG API Machinery.
labels.name: sig/api-machinery

title: Invalid Content-Type text/plain on responses returned from APIServer
